title: Tearing and micro stutter after Windows 10 upgrade.
body:
Yesterday i upgraded Windows 10, and today i noticed that LoL is "laggy" even though i'm playing with 80 fps as usual.
I noticed that, if i turn V-Sync on, the tearing goes away, but i don't want to play with V-Sync.
I tried using LoL repairing tool, turning game DVR off and reinstalling my graphic card driver, but it didn't work. Here are my system informations:

CPU: i7 - 4710 HQ 2.50 Ghz
GPU: GTX 860m, 2gb. Driver version: 388.43
Ram: 8gb
Windows 10 Home, version 1709, build 16299.98


Edit: the issue goes away if i set "borderless" mode too, but i prefer Full Screen as i've always played like this.

replies.body:
Heya, I asked our tech team about this and it may be an issue with a compatibility setting.  The following steps may help: 

- Open up C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\0.0.1.196\deploy
- Right-click on League of Legends.exe and click on Properties
- Click on the Compatibility tab
- Check the box for "Disable fullscreen optimizations" 
- Press Apply, then OK.

As an additional step, disabling the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) can help clear things up.

This should fix things up while still allowing you to play in Full Screen! :D
It worked. Thanks a lot for your help! Have a good day ^_^
